name: Paleo Crab Cakes
author: Sarah Pryor
summary: Crab cakes that are an excellent appetizer or meal all by themselves!
ingredients: 1 ½ teaspoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay®)
¼ teaspoon hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)
⅓ cup almond flour for dredging
directions: Beat egg, mayonnaise, red pepper flakes, seafood seasoning, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, hot pepper sauce, lemon juice, and black pepper together in a bowl until smooth
Place crabmeat into a separate bowl, trying to not break too many of the big chunks; add 1/4 cup almond flour, parsley, and green onion
Pour egg mixture over the crabmeat mixture and gently mix until dry ingredients are completely moistened; shape into 12 cakes
Spread 1/3 cup almond flour into a wide, shallow bowl
Roll cakes in almond flour to coat and arrange into the prepared baking dish
Refrigerate crab cakes for at least 1 hour
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Bake in preheated oven until hot in the center and golden brown on the outside, 15 to 20 minutes
